item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "There might be some hours of loneliness. But there was something wonderful even in loneliness. At least you belonged to yourself when you were lonely." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "You may tire of reality but you never tire of dreams." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Ann Rinaldi
item.description: "Love is like light and there are two kinds, the bursting fireworks of the moment and the solid, fixed stars that sometimes become obscured in the heavens, but are always there, year after year, for a lifetime." -- Ann Rinaldi

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by John Galsworthy
item.description: "One's eyes are what one is, one's mouth is what one becomes." -- John Galsworthy

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The whole of life is just like watching a film. Only it's as though you always get in ten minutes after the big picture has started, and no-one will tell you the plot, so you have to work it out all yourself from the clues." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There is a rumour going around that I have found God. I think this is unlikely because I have enough difficulty finding my keys, and there is empirical evidence that they exist." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Ginger: You know what the greatest tragedy is in the whole world?... It's all the people who never find out what it is they really want to do or what it is they're really good at. It's all the sons who become blacksmiths because their fathers were blacksmiths. It's all the people who could be really fantastic flute players who grow old and die without ever seeing a musical instrument, so they become bad plowmen instead. It's all the people with talents who never even find out. Maybe they are never even <i>born</i> in a time when it's even possible to find out. It's all the people who never get to know what it is that they can really be. <i>It's all the wasted chances</i>." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Scientists have calculated that the chances of something so patently absurd actually existing are millions to one. But magicians have calculated that million-to-one chances crop up nine times out of ten." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Inside every sane person there's a madman struggling to get out," said the shopkeeper. "That's what I've always thought. No one goes mad quicker than a totally sane person." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Humans need fantasy to be human. To be the place where the falling angel meets the rising ape." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description:
"Anne laughed.
"I don't want sunbursts or marble halls, I just want you." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Fear is the original sin. Almost all of the evil in the world has its origin in the fact that some one is afraid of something.It is a cold slimy serpent coiling about you. It is horrible to live with fear; and it is of all things degrading." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "there's no use trying to live in other people's opinions. The only thing to do is live in your own." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "The body grows slowly and steadily but the soul grows by leaps and bounds. It may come to its full stature in an hour." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If it weren't for greed, intolerance, hate, passion and murder, you would have no works of art, no great buildings, no medical science, no Mozart, no Van Gough, no Muppets and no Louis Armstrong." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Books may look like nothing more than words on a page, but they are actually an infinitely complex imaginotransference technology that translates odd, inky squiggles into pictures inside your head." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "I would so hate to be a first-person character! Always on your guard, always having people read your thoughts!" -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "History has rewritten itself so many times I'm not really sure how it was to begin with -- it's a bit like trying to guess the original color of a wall when it's been repainted eight times." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "One is left with the horrible feeling now that war settles nothing; that to win a war is as disastrous as to lose one." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "I know there's a proverb which that says 'To err is human,' but a human error is nothing to what a computer can do if it tries." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Bronwyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Life seems but a quick succession of busy nothings." -- Jane Austen
